intro: Guettarda costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican guettarda, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, often with a faintly aromatic scent. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Guettarda costaricensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
